item.title: sticking finger up at camera whilst walking past | 15th June 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On the 15th of June, 2024, the individual residing in flat number 14 was observed via our security footage...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On the 15th of June, 2024, the individual residing in flat number 14 was observed via our security footage making an offensive gesture with his middle finger directed at the camera while passing by our window. Additionally, towards the conclusion of the video clip, he is seen making a similar gesture towards the bedroom window, where a non-functional camera is installed.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS for Joe at WDH to see

Impact:
Annoying

Details:
At approximately 4:48 PM, the resident of number 14 proceeded to take his dog outside for its 20 second a day walk to the adjacent grassy area. Subsequent to re-entering his flat with the dog, he then navigated towards the side of the flat’s. Upon passing by the window, he abruptly turned back and gestured inappropriately towards the surveillance cameras. Attached is a video recording captured by our living room security camera. It should be noted that another camera, located in our bedroom, was also subjected to the offensive gesture; although currently non-operational, its presence is discernible in the latter part of the attached video.

Video: basic Microsoft webcam in living room window

Photos:

item.title: Outside light punched, pacing In dark portending to be on phone to take photos | 8th June 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On June 8, 2024, disturbances began around 1:30 AM with noises akin to hammering. The individual from flat number...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On June 8, 2024, disturbances began around 1:30 AM with noises akin to hammering. The individual from flat number 14 was suspected of searching for surveillance cameras, as evidenced by his behavior with his dog and previous incidents involving his associates. Despite considering contacting WDH’s out-of-hours service, the intermittent cessation of noise led us to refrain. Later, the tenant exhibited suspicious behavior outside, including feigned phone conversations and observable flashes from his phone camera, suggesting covert recording activities. At 3:20 AM, he approached the door, likely recording, and at 3:42 AM, he struck an exterior light fixture. These actions are consistent with past observations of drug-related transactions and usage, specifically cocaine, as well as withdrawal symptoms during periods without narcotics.
Reported To:
WDH and the police

Impact:
Caused stress that negatively affects Lucy’s heart condition’s.

Key Points:
Stressed, Annoying, logged as “endangerment”,

Details:
On the 8th of June, 2024, at approximately 1:30 AM, we were disturbed by loud noises resembling hammering, which interrupted our sleep and prompted us to consider contacting the out-of-hours service provided by WDH. However, the noise ceased intermittently, leading us to believe it would stop like normal, rendering a service call potentially unnecessary. Subsequently, just before 2:00 AM, we observed the individual from flat number 14 descending the stairs with considerable force, ostensibly to walk his dog. We have reasons to suspect that his true intention was to search for surveillance equipment, a behavior we have witnessed on multiple occasions. This suspicion is supported by the fact that he was observed pacing back and forth and interrupting the dog’s natural behavior, as captured in the accompanying video at the 44-second mark.

Our previous incident report includes footage of an associate of the tenant from flat number 14 attempting to open our door while the tenant himself stood by his own door, presumably to ascertain the presence of a camera monitoring that area.

Thirty minutes later, at 2:31 AM, the tenant returned outdoors without his dog and loitered for several minutes. This activity is highlighted in the video with a motion-tracing arrow. During this time, he appeared to engage in a phone conversation, but the intermittent flashes from his phone camera, particularly when he moved through shadowed areas, suggest otherwise. These flashes are evident in the video at 1:30 and again at 2:24.

At 3:20 into the video, the tenant approaches the door, continuing the pretense of a phone conversation, likely with the intent of recording video footage. We believe this was done to scrutinize the area for cameras with greater detail at a later time. Shortly thereafter, he is seen striking the exterior light fixture, an act clearly visible in the video at 3:42.

This incident appears to be another instance of erratic behavior, which we have observed to correlate with periods when the tenant lacks narcotics. Such behavior includes restlessness and involuntary movements, symptomatic of withdrawal from potent drugs.

While we cannot definitively identify the substance involved, there is a strong likelihood that it is cocaine, based on repeated observations of the tenant engaging in transactions involving white powders at his doorstep. This has been corroborated by several neighbors and is further evidenced by frequent visits to vehicles and motorcycles, as well as audible indications of drug use, including chopping sounds, snorting, and exclamations, occurring sporadically throughout the day and night.

Video: (New camera setup, a21 phone camera in door peep hole)
     ⓘ This video utilizes media codecs that are incompatible with Firefox and requires a browser based on Chrome to play.

ⓘ The video lacks audio as it is streamed via YouTube directly to a private profile. This approach not only leverages YouTube’s unlimited storage capacity but also ensures access to the footage in the event the recording device is compromised. Nonetheless, due to YouTube’s copyright policies, the audio was removed after detecting copyrighted content from a television program in the background.
Click here to enlarge.

Photos: (small selection of screenshots taken from video)

item.title: Bird feeder trashed, sticking finger up at camera, spitting on door & windows | 26th April 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On the 26th of April, 2024, our sleep was disrupted by significant noise. Upon consulting our security camera, we...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On the 26th of April, 2024, our sleep was disrupted by significant noise. Upon consulting our security camera, we observed the resident of unit number 14 engaging in the forceful dismantlement of our bird feeder affixed to the wall. A review of the recorded footage revealed that at 1:50 AM, this individual directed an offensive gesture towards our room camera. At 2:32 AM, he was documented returning to the front of the property, where he loitered and exhibited restless behavior.
At 5:30 AM, the individual emerged with his dog, seemingly conducting a visual inspection of the surroundings. After escorting the dog back inside, he returned alone and proceeded to vandalize our bird feeder. Subsequently, at 5:50 AM, he was captured by the living room window repeating the offensive gesture and uttering a phrase that could be interpreted as a derogatory remark, before retreating to his residence.

Reported To:
WDH and the police

Impact:
Caused a lot of stress that negatively affects Lucy’s heart condition’s.

Key Points:
Stressed, Annoying, logged as “criminal damage”,

Details:
At approximately 5:30 AM, we were abruptly awakened by a series of loud bangs and heavy footsteps. Upon awakening, we observed through our door camera’s live feed that the individual residing at flat number 14 was forcibly removing our bird feeder from the exterior wall. It appeared that the feeder was detached, possibly by severing the steel core cable ties securing it. Subsequently, the individual was seen off-camera compressing the feeder and discarding it into our brown waste container.

In response to this disturbance, we reviewed the recorded footage from the entire night and early morning. The recordings revealed that at 1:50 AM, the same individual was present at our living room window, making an obscene gesture directed towards it. Later, at 2:32 AM, the individual was again captured by the camera returning to the front of our residence and began to walk back and forth near our front door.

The initial commotion that roused us at approximately 5:20 AM included more banging and stomping, audible even through silicone earplugs. The footage shows the individual exiting his residence with a dog, surveying the area as though to ensure no one was present. He then returned the dog indoors and re-emerged alone, continuing to pace near our front door while frequently glancing towards it, as if anticipating someone’s appearance. This behavior persisted for roughly ten minutes, during which he expectorated on the door and proceeded to rearrange our outdoor chairs before ultimately damaging and removing the bird feeder, as previously described.

It is noteworthy that the bird feeder had been installed for approximately one year, serving as a replacement for a prior feeder that had been similarly vandalized.

At 5:50 AM, the individual was once again observed making an obscene gesture towards the camera and appeared to verbalize an insult, which could be interpreted as “f**k off you stupid bastards,” before retreating to his flat.

Video: (New camera setup, a21 phone camera in door peep hole + clear door view)
————(other camera: basic Microsoft webcam in living room window)

item.title: Looking in the letter box with phone | 9th March 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On the 9th of March 2024, we experienced an intrusion of privacy when we were disturbed by the sound...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On the 9th of March 2024, we experienced an intrusion of privacy when we were disturbed by the sound of our letterbox being manipulated. Surveillance footage revealed the individual residing at number 14 engaging in suspicious activity involving our letterbox. This individual was documented using a mobile device to peer inside our letterbox on two separate occasions: initially at 4:14 AM, and subsequently at 6:10 AM. During the latter instance, the device’s flash was activated, and the camera application was visibly in use, suggesting the capture of photographic or video content. This evidence was promptly compiled and submitted to the police for investigation.

Reported To:
WDH and the police

Impact:
Made us worried he will try doing something again, possible checking what camera we have and where they are as he seemed to be recording and/or taking pictures with his phone, and he’ll be aware that the cameras can be viewed behind the front door from the time he previously put a brick through it.

Key Points:
Tired, Very Stressed, Lucy has stress chest pain, and can’t sleep

Details:
In the early morning hours, we were awakened by a disturbance which was subsequently identified as the sound of our letterbox being tampered with. Upon reviewing the footage from our security cameras, it was evident that the individual responsible was the occupant of the flat at number 14. This person was observed utilizing a mobile device to peer into our letterbox.

The presumed intent behind this action is to ascertain the locations of our security cameras. This deduction is based on the fact that immediately behind the entrance door, there is a laptop display that provides a live feed of two such cameras. The individual’s awareness of this setup is likely due to a previous incident where they hurled a brick through our window, which afforded them a view of the interior.

The initial occurrence of this behavior was recorded at precisely 4:14 AM, during which the individual was seen loitering and subsequently inspecting the letterbox with their phone, presumably capturing images or video. A subsequent incident was observed at 6:10 AM, which we witnessed in real-time, having been unable to return to sleep in anticipation of further disturbances.

This matter was reported to the police; however, the response has been protracted over several months, with a lack of communication and follow-up on their part. Despite our efforts to obtain updates, we have not received any correspondence for over two and a half months from the time of this writing. The incident remains classified as ‘open’ on the official police website. Due to this apparent inaction, WDH has been impeded in their ability to proceed with their responsibilities.

Video: (New camera setup, a21 phone camera in door peep hole + clear door view)
 ~this setup was new and didn’t have a microphone at the time.

item.title: Front Door Window Smashed with Brick | 10th January 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On January 10th, 2024, while celebrating Lucy’s birthday, we discovered upon our return that the front door window of...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On January 10th, 2024, while celebrating Lucy’s birthday, we discovered upon our return that the front door window of our residence had been deliberately shattered. The individual from unit 14, who has a history of causing disturbances, was identified as the perpetrator. Law enforcement was notified, and we submitted our CCTV footage, which audibly captured the neighbor conversing with an accomplice. The attending officer, after reviewing the recording, expressed skepticism towards their concocted alibi, suggesting an unknown assailant was responsible, thus indicating their probable deception.

Reported To:
WDH and the police

Impact:
The incident precipitated considerable distress, overshadowing the celebration of Ms. Lucy’s birthday. The severity of the stress exacerbated her pre-existing heart condition, leading to acute chest pain and heightening her health risks. Financially, we incurred expenses amounting to £67 for the requisite repairs and temporary boarding of the damaged window. Additionally, our pet cat suffered an injury, with shards of glass affecting her eye, causing her pain and further distress.

Key Points:
Extreme Stress, Lucy has stress chest pain, glass everywhere, cat’s eye injured, we had to pay instead of the person who smashed it.

Details:
We left to celebrate Lucy’s birthday with a dinner outing. Upon our return, we discovered the front door window of our flat had been shattered by a brick. Given the harmonious relationships we maintain with our community, it was immediately apparent to us that the individual residing at number 14 was the likely perpetrator. This tenant’s history of disruptive and aggressive behavior is well-known among the residents, including instances of public intoxication and an unprovoked assault on another neighbor with a metal baseball bat, followed by fabricated defenses that have previously allowed him to evade consequences.

Upon entering our residence, we promptly reviewed footage from the security camera installed within our letterbox. The recording confirmed the involvement of two individuals in the act of vandalism: the aforementioned tenant of number 14 and an associate known to frequent his company. These individuals were captured fabricating a narrative involving an unidentified third party, allegedly masked and responsible for the damage, a claim which was subsequently dismissed by the responding police officer as a probable attempt to obfuscate their culpability.

Regrettably, due to the limited field of vision of our security apparatus at the time, capturing only ground-level activity, no further investigative measures were pursued, and the individuals in question were not subjected to official inquiry.

Video: (old LetterBox cam pointing at ground but has audio)

Photos: Click to enlarge.

item.title: Eggs thrown at house | 18th December 2023
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On the 18th of December, 2023, our flat was subjected to a series of disturbances during the nocturnal hours....
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On the 18th of December, 2023, our flat was subjected to a series of disturbances during the nocturnal hours. These disruptions included audible shouting and the impact of eggs being hurled against our residence. Additionally, there was forceful knocking on our front door. These events are consistent with the pattern of harassment we have previously documented, involving similar acts of vandalism and attempted unauthorized entry.

The incident was formally reported to WDH, resulting in the initiation of a new case file managed by Joe. Our previous case manager, Richard, exhibited a lack of initiative in addressing our concerns. He frequently expressed a desire to conclude our case prematurely and neglected to include us on the out-of-hours service list on time when it would have been of use. This oversight led to the forfeiture of three potential uses of the service. Despite eventually being added to the list, the sporadic nature of the disturbances rendered it impractical to arrange for observation.
Moreover, Richard had committed to reclassifying our case from a noise complaint to one of harassment and assault following an incident of physical aggression on the 25th of September, 2023. Unfortunately, this reclassification was not executed, and our case was subsequently closed a week later without resolution.
In contrast, Joe has demonstrated a commendable level of assistance and engagement with our situation thus far.

Impact:
The persistent disturbances have significantly heightened anxiety levels within the household, particularly for Lucy. Each unexpected noise triggers a state of panic, stemming from the apprehension that it may be the neighbor engaging in further disruptive behavior. This ongoing situation has exacerbated existing concerns, contributing to a reluctance to venture outside and a general sense of unease.

Key Points:
The front door of our residence has been subjected to repeated acts of vandalism.
The frequency of being awoken by disturbances has reached an intolerable level, with countless occurrences since our tenancy commenced.
The disturbances have had a distressing effect on the domestic animals within the household.
The situation poses a direct risk to Lucy’s health, especially considering her pre-existing heart condition, which the neighbor has been made aware of.
The repeated defacement of our property with eggs, despite efforts to clean, represents a deliberate pattern of harassment. Each cleaning effort is met with an immediate reoccurrence of the vandalism.

Details:
Beginning at approximately 10:00 PM, we experienced repeated disturbances approximately every thirty minutes, which we perceived as hammering noises emanating from the floor. Subsequently, our sleep was further disrupted by loud shouting and forceful banging on our front entrance. Upon reviewing our security footage, we observed that our front door, along with the windows of the spare bedroom, bathroom, and kitchen, had been vandalized with eggs.

Further examination of our letterbox camera, which is part of our previous security system, revealed the presence of an individual’s feet and the sound of his voice as he aggressively knocked on our door, uttering profanities and demanding silence, despite the fact that we had been in bed since 9:00 PM.

The same individual was later captured on camera returning to the scene and hurling eggs at the door. Additionally, we discovered that the door handle was damaged and no longer functioning properly, leading us to surmise that there may have been an attempt to gain unauthorized entry, a situation we have unfortunately encountered on previous occasions.

In a separate incident shortly beforehand, we observed the individual approach our residence, knock briefly, then retreat and wait before proceeding to throw eggs at the window of a smaller bedroom. Although this act was audible on the Door Cam, it was not visible due to the limitations of our older camera setup. Given the timing of these events, it is reasonable to infer that there was a premeditated intention to commit further acts of vandalism inside the premises or directly towards us upon opening the door.

Video: (Can’t find the video without text overlay, this one has text descriptions)

item.title: Attacked whilst having a cig outside | 25th September 2023
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On the 25th of September, 2023, I was subjected to an unprovoked assault while smoking outside my residence. At...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On the 25th of September, 2023, I was subjected to an unprovoked assault while smoking outside my residence. At that time, we had not anticipated the need for surveillance equipment due to our amicable relations with the surrounding residents and the absence of any prior hostilities. Regrettably, the only available footage captures the aftermath of the incident, including the assailant’s aggressive attempts to gain entry into our residence prior to the arrival of law enforcement.

Assault Summery:
The presumed catalyst for the assailant’s behavior may be attributed to substance depletion, likely cocaine, which possibly exacerbated his already erratic conduct. This incident followed our formal complaint regarding excessive noise emanating from his residence—a matter we had previously addressed through civil discourse to no avail, as corroborated by WDH and the environmental health agency’s unsuccessful attempts at communication.

Reason for assault:
We think he had run out of cocaine, and was acting childish because we had recently reported him for making too much noise (which we attempted to speak with him about like polite adults, as have WDH and the environmental health agency to no avail because he simply ignores everyone.)

Reported To:
The altercation was promptly reported to both WDH and the police. The responding officers apprehended the assailant; however, he was released subsequent to providing a counterstatement alleging self-defense. Upon his return, he inflicted damage to the exterior wall of our residence. The incident was recorded by WDH, but the response from the assigned representative, Richard, was unsatisfactory, as he displayed a lack of interest in resolving our concerns and failed to include us in the out-of-hours service list at the time it was needed. This oversight resulted in missed opportunities for intervention. Since then, the assailant has engaged in deliberate noise disturbances at irregular intervals, complicating the process for WDH representatives to witness the infractions.

Impact:
The incident necessitated immediate medical attention for Michael at the Accident and Emergency department due to significant facial swelling and an ocular injury, which impaired his vision for an extended period exceeding two months. The assault resulted in a diagnosed concussion, facial contusions, and an eye trauma. The repercussions extended beyond physical injuries, inducing considerable psychological distress and apprehension. The fear instigated by the event led to a marked reduction in our willingness to leave the residence, a cessation of previous habits such as smoking outside, and a reluctance to venture out after dark. The presence of the assailant in the vicinity continues to be a source of anxiety, with concerns over potential recurrence of such violence. For enhanced security, we have altered our sleeping arrangements, opting to stay in the living room, which is strategically located closer to the entrance. Concerns also persist regarding the integrity of the property’s entrance, following the assailant’s repeated attempts to compromise it. Despite attempts to address the situation through written communication, there has been a lack of response and no discernible resolution.

Key Points:
The assault has had lasting effects, with persistent discomfort in my eye, which remains sensitive to touch. The assailant explicitly threatened our lives, and the physical aggression was directed solely at me, with the potential for further harm had we not retreated indoors. Medical professionals at the Accident and Emergency department confirmed the severity of the concussion. There were false allegations made to the police by the assailant, claiming I was the instigator. Following his release, he engaged in further destructive behavior, damaging the wall adjacent to our residence, which is believed to be part of multiple attempts to gain unauthorized entry.

Details:
while I was smoking outside my residence and concurrently relocating refuse that had been improperly deposited at our doorstep, I was approached in an aggressive manner by the occupant of 14 Pine Close. This individual vociferously questioned my actions with profanity and proceeded to physically assault me without provocation. In self-defense, I attempted to disengage by obstructing his vision, pulling his jacket over his face, but he escalated the altercation by forcibly throwing me to the ground, inserting his finger into my ocular cavity, and continuing to strike me. This assault induced a sensation of unconsciousness, and had it not been for the intervention of my partner, who requires my care due to her disabilities, I believe the assailant could have caused permanent blindness or further harm.

We managed to retreat to the safety of our residence and promptly alerted the authorities. Meanwhile, the assailant continued his violent behavior, causing damage to the property’s entrance, necessitating repairs by WDH. Upon the arrival of law enforcement, the assailant was detained, and I was sent to the Accident and Emergency department for medical evaluation. Despite the severity of my injuries, which included facial swelling, impaired vision, and necessitated the consumption of analgesics for an extended period, the assailant was only subjected to a brief incarceration. Furthermore, upon his release, he immediately resumed his destructive actions by damaging the wall adjacent to our doorway, which again required repair services provided by WDH.

Video: (Can’t find the video without text overlay, this one has text descriptions)

Photos: Click to enlarge.
